supporting.text: The expression (8 − 3) evaluates to 5, and (2 + 1) evaluates to 3. Multiplying these results (5 × 3) gives 15.

attacks.text: The expression (8 − 3) evaluates to 5, and (2 + 1) evaluates to 3. Multiplying these results (5 × 3) gives 15.

supporting.text: Following the order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS), parentheses are evaluated first, yielding 5 × 3, which equals 15.

attacks.text: Following the order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS), parentheses are evaluated first, yielding 5 × 3, which equals 15.

supporting.text: Substituting the values directly: (5) × (3) = 15, confirming the correctness of the equation.
